data.title: Great Food, Beautiful Patio
data.text:
I had never been to Por Favor.  What was I thinking?
The food is great.  Service is courteous & fast!
The patio is very fun to sit in.  The colors of all the murals & tiles were beautiful.

data.title: Good, basic Mexican with good ambience
data.text: Went here for dinner, and had their Enchiladas del Mar.  The shrimp was fresh and the sauces were good.  Nice to be able to have a good draft IPA (Sculpin in this case) with dinner, instead of the usual beer choices at Mexican restaurants.  I liked the outside courtyard seating on a warm evening and the service was excellent.

data.title: Joe G.
data.text: Pork Favor is a good choice for a casual sit down mexican meal. My family and friends are sort of regulars at the La Mesa location.  It's always good.

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text:
We love the Carnitas here, its so much food that I always have to share with my husband and we still need a to go box.. We like to bring friends here for lunch.  They have a very nice out door patio with lots of shade. They also have a indoor eating area.
I have to say it is my favorite Mexican Restaurant.

data.title: Great place to eat while watching the car show go by...
data.text: Great place to sit and eat while watching the Wednesday car show go by. Out door seating, great Mexican food. I had the chicken Caesar salad my wife had the tostada. and a couple of margaritas of course. Great food and service to be had here.

data.title: Like going to Old Nogales in the '70's!
data.text: Great atmosphere right in the heart of the art and fashion shops on Main Street!  Beautiful outside patio, fabulous Old Mexico tiles, pottery, and decor.  VERY accomodating service with staff who genuinely enjoy their job!  The food is very good and very reasonable.  I'm a sucker for their fish tacos, and girlfriends enjoy the big taco salads.

data.title: " Server Had and Attitude & My Food Never Came "
data.text:
This place SUCKS ! Several people in our swim class went to Por Favor Mexican Restaurant & Cantina in El Cajon, Ca. today for lunch and we had a horrible experience ! First of all the server had the worst attitude and we had to ask her over and over to bring us water and other items to the table for us. We ordered our food finally, and some of the orders took over 45 minutes before they got to our table. I ordered one chicken tostada which should have taken very little time to make. Half of the orders they brought to our table were not ordered by us. They must have been some other tables orders. And when we told the server that the meals were not ours, she said " Its not my fault, someone else took my orders " ! We waited longer and longer for our original orders to come out from the kitchen again, and 3 of the guests at our table never received there meals, NEVER ! So we got up and left the restaurant after being seated for over 1 1/2 hours. The food that did come out to some of the tables looked terrible, and one of the ladies in our group said she even found a cockroach walking across her table. Terrible Customer Service ! I will never go here again !

Add to list  Edit

data.title: The only thing missing are the mariachi bands playing!
data.text: Having visited Mexico many times, we  say we really feel like we were in a restaurant in Mexico, except there were no mariachi bands playing. The food was authentic, plentiful and delicious. Neither one of us could finish our meals. The black bean soup was very good and our entrees were also very good. The service was very good and attentive, except the entrees were brought too close to when the soups were brought out.

data.title: Please More Por Favor!😃
data.text:
After walking by several times in the evening when it was much busier and we were not looking for dinner, we noted the breakfast option!  

So we came in for more of a brunch on Saturday. Sat outside. Beautiful atmosphere and ultra friendly staff. 

We opted for a sangria and sparkling wine. Got the huevos rancheros (fried eggs with beans) and potatoes and the huevos con chorizo) scrambled with sausage. 

EVERYTHING was fresh and had a very homemade taste...down to the tortillas. More great news...breakfast is served all day! Gracias indeed...we will return!!!

data.title: "Best Mexican Food"
data.text: This was our first time here and loved the food.. Ordered chicken fajitas which showed up with a sizzling flair.  Price was reasonable

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: This place was recommended to me by a client years ago, but until we moved out here to El Cajon, I had never tried it. The first time I did, my son and I wanted someplace different for lunch one day, and I remembered the referral. We got there later in the afternoon and it just happened to be Happy Hour. Yay for us!! I ordered two of the carnitas tacos, thinking it's happy hour so they'll be small. Oh my gosh! Each one came on a separate plate, they were huge! They were delicious as well. My son had the carnitas quesadilla and the chimichanga, they too were good sized and yummy. Our drinks were great, I expected the typical watered down version of a happy hour drink, but this was not the case. I went again with a friend and although we were just grabbing a couple of drinks, we found the service great, and the atmosphere welcoming. This is my go to spot now.

data.title: It's Great
data.text: Fast  friendly good food. We ate outside perfect for bringing out of town guests. Prices are very reasonable. Great margarita's.

data.title: perfect happy hour, festive ambiance
data.text: If you are looking for some yummy food and very reasonable prices come to Por Favor in El Cajon! most days are lovely in El Cajon so go out to the patio and enjoy the beautiful courtyard. Happy hour provides good margaritas and ample portions of happy hour food chouces at a good price. Happy hour appetizers are generous in size. The Caesar salad is huge enough to share. I give it for 4 its class. We will definitely return. service is excellent.

data.title: Good food and margarita,s
data.text: Very good food, service and drinks. Nice indoor or outdoor dining with misters to keep you cool while eating.

data.title: Great Mexican Food!
data.text: Best Mexican food in Southern California, or anywhere else in our opinion! The only drawback is parking can be a problem when they have all the classic cars downtown.

data.title: Excellent Mexican food in downtown El Cajon
data.text: Por Favor is run by the same nice folks who own Downtown Cafe, and the Por Favor in La Mesa. Really good Mexican fare, lots of beer choices, and authentic ambiance and food. Fun spot for lunch meetings. Located on Main Street near city hall in El Cajon.

data.title: Want Mexican.???
data.text: Well Por Favor on Main Street in El Cajon is not the place to go.  They do have great Margarita's if that is what you need, how ever the food and service do leave a little bit lacking.  The meals that I have ordered have always been a little less in the flavor and the service is also lacking.  Some days its pretty good and in other days is an Oh Well, as its something that you get on different days.  I would not recommend eating there if you are looking for an excellent Mexican meal...

data.title: Good Mexican food
data.text: Great service, delicious tasting food and fantastic hot carrots.  Ambiance presents a pleasant dining experience and the servers are always quick to respond to your wishes.

data.title: Good Old Fashioned Mexican Food
data.text: This was our first time here and hope it won’t be the last. The have a nice atmosphere and some interesting murals on the walls. The menu is comprehensive, but they don’t, to our surprise, have tamales. But they do have tostadas, which can be hard to find. Some of our group ordered a la cart, to cut down on the calories. Another had the shrimp fajitas which showed up with a sizzling flair. Another guest had a tostada, and some had tacos, and one had a enchilada. Others had combinations. Everyone enjoyed their lunches and cleaned their plates. Parking is on street, but we didn’t have any trouble finding a close spot even though it was a Sunday around noon.

data.title: Large portions at very reasonable prices
data.text: A very good choice if you have a large group looking  for authentic Mexican food. There were 8 in our party of golfers. A small margueritas is huge. I had a mango fruit and it was a real thirst quencher. I ordered a chimichanga and it also was huge. The other 7 were pleased with their choices.
